div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 128px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
Invoked before a component is unmounted from the DOM via
unmountComponentAtNode(). Perform any necessary cleanup here

switch.text:
Invoked before a component is unmounted from the DOM via 
unmountComponentAtNode().  Perform any necessary cleanup here

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 60px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
Must call `super()` first, or `super(props)` if access to props is required.
`this` is undefined if called prior to super(). State initialization is allowed.
Binding event handlers is recommended so they are only bound once

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 114px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
Invoked once on the client and server. You can handle state and
configuration. Props and initial state are defined at this point.

switch.text:
Invoked once on the client and server.  You can handle state and
configuration. Props and initial state are defined at this point.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 36px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div: Required. It must not modify component state.

switch.text: Required.  It must not modify component state.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 96px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
Invoked before any instances are created and thus cannot rely on
`this.props`. Complex objects returned here are shared and not copied.
Values assigned in the mapping will be available on `this.props`

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 82px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
Invoked once and the return value will be used as the initial value of
`this.state`. Use to seed data for the component's internally-controlled
state but not to generate it.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 112px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
Perform work here if browser interaction is required. Access to the native
UI and children via `refs` is available. Children loads from bottom up.
Another useful task is setting up 3rd party UIs

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 146px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
State changes are triggered by `setState()` and fires exactly the same
lifecycle as Props Changes except for componentWillReceiveProps().
An incoming prop transition may require a state change but the opposite
is not true.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 126px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 44px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 126px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 162px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
Use this as an opportunity to react to a prop transition or compare old and
new props before render. The old props can be accessed via `this.props`.
You MUST NOT assume that your props have changed.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 146px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
`return true` by default, or `return false` if you don't require a component
update. if `false` componentWillUpdate() and componentDidUdpate() will
not be called.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 126px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
State changes are not allowed because it will trigger another component
update causing an infinite loop. Handle configuration changes here or
dispatch call a function based on state change.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 44px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 126px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div:
Operate on the DOM when the component has been updated. Manage
3rd party or query the Native UI to get the DOM properties or styling
information.
